original_title: Starstruck: Gene Kelly's Love Letter to Ballet
overview: One of the first choreographers to bring the ‘American style’ to Europe, the legendary Gene Kelly was invited to create an original work for the Paris Opera Ballet in 1960. His jazzy, joyful Pas de Dieux was highly acclaimed at the time but has been rarely performed since. The Scottish Ballet has lovingly revived the original ballet and added a delightful new twist.
tagline: Robust and athletic, Gene Kelly's choreography impressed the dance world. In 1960 the Paris Opera Ballet invited him to create something for them, the `Pas de Dieux'.
title: Starstruck: Gene Kelly's Love Letter to Ballet
